item.title: Small Business Innovation to Job Creation Act of 2010

latestAction.text: Referred to House Science and Technology

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

summary.text: Small Business Innovation to Job Creation Act of 2010 - Authorizes the Administrator of the Small Business Administration (SBA) to make grants to small businesses to commercialize research developed by such businesses using funds received under the second phase of the Small Business Innovation Research Program (a program under which a portion of a federal agency's research and development effort is reserved for award to small businesses). Terminates the grant program at the end of FY2011.

bill.title: Small Business Innovation to Job Creation Act of 2010

item.title: Small Business Innovation to Job Creation Act of 2010

A bill to authorize the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to make grants to small business concerns to assist the commercialization of research developed with funds received under the second phase of the Small Business Innovation Research Program.
Small Business Innovation to Job Creation Act of 2010

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
